results.name: Triangle T(n, k) = C(n,k) - C(n-2,k-1) for n >= 3 and T(n, k) = 1 otherwise, read by rows.
comment: Starting 1,0,1,1,1,... this is the Riordan array ((1-x+x^2)/(1-x), x/(1-x)). Its diagonal sums are A006355. Its inverse is A106509. - _Paul Barry_, May 04 2005
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..50 of the triangle, flattened
formula: T(n, k) = C(n,k) - C(n-2,k-1) for n >= 3 and T(n, k) = 1 otherwise.
T(n, k) = T(n-1, k-1) + T(n-1, k) starting with T(2, 0) = T(2, 1) = T(2, 2) = 1 and T(n, 0) = T(n, n) = 1.
T(n, k, q) = q*[n=2] + Sum_{j=0..5} q^j*binomial(n-2*j, k-j)*[n>2*j] with T(n,0) = T(n,n) = 1 for q = -1. (End)
mathematica: t[2, 1] = 1; t[n_, n_] = t[_, 0] = 1; t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = t[n-1, k-1] + t[n-1, k]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, 12}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 28 2013, after _Ralf Stephan_ *)
program: T:= func< n,k | n lt 3 select 1 else Binomial(n,k) - Binomial(n-2,k-1) >;
[T(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 28 2021
def T(n,k): return 1 if n<3 else binomial(n,k) - binomial(n-2,k-1)
flatten([[T(n,k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 28 2021
